member.summary:
Stores the data of a "Request to Ping" used by the Server in Client-Server Mode to send arbitrary "pings" to a connecting Client.
This allows the local NAT Table to be updated with the right mapping information from the remote client, increasing the chance of the local Server to receive any connect request from the remote peer.

member.name: T:Fusion.Accuracy
member.summary:
Indicates the rounding factor of compressed values. All values will be truncated to the nearest multiple of this.
For example; A value of 0.012345f compressed with an Accuracy of 0.001, becomes 0.012f
An Accuracy setting of 0 is uncompressed.

member.name: T:Fusion.NetworkCharacterController
member.summary:
Provides custom API and state replication for collider-based character controller movement (not related to Unity's CharacterController type). Replicates both the internal state (Velocity, MaxSpeed, etc) and the Unity Transform data from the to all other peers. Add this component to a GameObject to control movement and sync the position and/or rotation accurately, including client-side prediction.
Usage - For basic prototyping call the following methods: NetworkCharacterController.Move()
NetworkCharacterController.Jump()
For more advanced uses, call only the movement query to get full surface movement data (), and implement bespoke Move/Steering: NetworkCharacterController.Jump()
A is required. Not to be combined with either nor . These are mutually-exclusive options.

member.name: T:Fusion.NetworkCharacterController.ICallbacks
member.summary: Collision and trigger callback interface that can optionally be passed to the movement query. Common uses: bypass a contact, apply a contact force to the target (can also be achieved just by adding a kinematic Rigidbody to the Character Controller.

member.summary: Called for all contacts with a trigger collider. Not affected by . data about the trigger collision

member.summary: Basic implementation of a full Move. Performs a movement query, uses its result to compute new Velocity, then applies penetration corrections + velocity integration into the transform position. Does not change Rotation. member.name: T:Fusion.HitboxManager
member.summary:
Entry point for lag compensated queries, which maintains a history buffer, and provides lag compensated raycast and overlap methods. Singleton instance is accessible through the property Runner.LagCompensation.
Usage - Call any of the following methods: HitboxManager.Raycast()
HitboxManager.RaycastAll()
HitboxManager.PositionRotation()
HitboxManager.OverlapSphere()
These methods use the history buffer to perform a query against a state consistent with how the indicated perceived them locally.

member.name: T:Fusion.HitboxRoot
member.summary:
Root group container. Manages registering/unregistering hitboxes with the group, and defines the broadphase geometry for the group.
Broadphase is the initial rough query used by raycasts/overlaps/etc to find potential hit candidates, which are then used in the final narrowphase query.

member.name: P:Fusion.HitboxRoot.HitboxRootActive
member.summary: Get or set the state of this HitboxRoot. For a hitbox to be hit by lag-compensated queries, both it and its HitboxRoot must be active.

member.name: F:Fusion.HitboxRoot.MAX_HITBOXES
member.summary: The max number of hitboxes allowed under the same root.

member.name: F:Fusion.HitboxRoot.BroadRadius
member.summary:
The radius of the broadphase bounding sphere for this group. Used by to insert/update lag compensated NetworkObjects into its BVH (bounding volume hierarchy) data structure. Be sure this radius encompasses all children components (including their full ranges of animation motion). We plan to offer an option to dynamically compute the bounding volume, but the performance trade of will still favor a hand-crafted radius.
Broadphase is the initial rough query used by raycasts/overlaps/etc to find potential hit candidates, which are then used in the final narrowphase query.

member.name: F:Fusion.HitboxRoot.Offset
member.summary:
Local-space offset of the broadphase bounding sphere from its transform position.
Adjust the and until the sphere gizmo (shown in the Unity Scene window) encompasses all children components (including their full ranges of animation motion).
Broadphase is the initial rough query used by raycasts/overlaps/etc to find potential hit candidates, which are then used in the final narrowphase query.

member.name: T:Fusion.PlayerRef
member.summary: Represents a Fusion player.
member.para: The PlayerRef, in contrast to the player index, is 1-based. The reason is that default(PlayerRef) will return a "null/invalid" player ref struct for convenience. There are automatic cast operators that can cast an int into a PlayerRef.

example.code: default(PlayerRef), internally a 0, means NOBODY PlayerRef, internally 1, is the same as player index 0 PlayerRef, internally 2, is the same as player index 1

member.name: T:Fusion.RpcAttribute
member.summary:
Flags a method as being a networked Remote Procedure Call. Only usable in a NetworkBehaviour.
Calls to this method (from the indicated allowed ) will generate a network message, which will execute the method remotely on the indicated . The RPC method can include an empty argument, that will include meta information about the RPC.
Example:
[Rpc(RpcSources.InputAuthority, RpcTargets.StateAuthority)]
RPC_Configure(NetworkObject no, string name, Color color, RpcInfo info = default) {}

member.name: P:Fusion.RpcAttribute.Sources
member.summary: The legal types that can trigger this Rpc. Cast to int.

member.name: P:Fusion.RpcAttribute.Targets
member.summary: The types that will receive and invoke this method. Cast to int.

member.name: P:Fusion.RpcAttribute.InvokeLocal
member.summary: Indicates if the method should be called locally (on the RPC caller). This happens immediately.

member.name: P:Fusion.RpcAttribute.InvokeResim
member.summary: Indicates if this RPC will execute during resims, or only once on the first execution of the associated tick.

member.name: P:Fusion.RpcAttribute.Channel
member.summary: Specifies which RpcChannel to use.

member.name: P:Fusion.RpcAttribute.TickAligned
member.summary: Indicates if this RPC's execution will be postponed until the local simulation catches up with the sender's Tick number. Even if set to false the order of Rpcs is preserved, i.e. unaligned Rpcs have to wait for preceeding aligned Rpcs to be executed first.

member.name: M:Fusion.RpcAttribute.#ctor(Fusion.RpcSources,Fusion.RpcTargets)
member.param: The legal types that can trigger this Rpc
The types that will receive and invoke this method

member.name: F:Fusion.RpcChannel.Reliable
member.summary: Rpc order preserved, delivery verified, resend in case of a failed delivery.

member.name: F:Fusion.RpcChannel.Unreliable
member.summary: Rpc order preserved, delivery not verified, no resend attempts.

member.name: T:Fusion.NetworkProjectConfig.PhysicsModes
member.summary:
Options for how physics is simulated on clients.
- Clients do not predict remote objects, and render in their remote time frame (relative past).
- Clients predict remote objects and have options for rendering them in local and/or remote time frames.

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkProjectConfig.PhysicsModes.ServerOnly
member.summary: The server simulates and sends states to all clients. Clients do not attempt prediction and will render remote objects in the server (relative past) time frame.

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkProjectConfig.PhysicsModes.ClientPrediction
member.summary: The server simulates and sends states to all clients. Clients simulate remote states forward into the local time frame (prediction).

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkProjectConfig.PeerMode

member.name: T:Fusion.AccuracyDefaults
member.summary:
Class that contains global accuracy information. Built-in named defaults can be edited, or custom named defaults can be created. These defaults allow you to change accuracy settings across an entire project.
These values can be changed in the .

member.summary: The named built-in default for Uncompressed. This cannot be changed and will always have a value of 0.

member.summary: The named built-in general default.

member.name: F:Fusion.AccuracyDefaults.POSITION

member.summary: Enumerates the types of state replication available.

member.name: F:Fusion.SimulationConfig.StateReplicationModes.DeltaSnapshots
member.summary: Server Authoritative, Delta Snapshots send the complete world state from every network tick. This produces the highest accuracy simulation replication, but may not be suitable for higher object and player counts.

member.name: F:Fusion.SimulationConfig.StateReplicationModes.EventualConsistency
member.summary: Server Authoritative, Eventual Consistency allows for partial/culled state transmission, which may be necessary for implementing Area of Interest, high networked object counts, or high player counts.

member.summary: The update rate of the simulation in Hz (ticks per second).

member.name: F:Fusion.SimulationConfig.DefaultPlayers
member.summary: The default number of players allowed to join a game instance. Can also be changed in code when starting Fusion.

member.name: F:Fusion.SimulationConfig.ReplicationMode
member.summary: Determines which mode will be used.

member.name: F:Fusion.SimulationConfig.Topology
member.summary: The topology used

member.name: F:Fusion.SimulationConfig.InterestManagement
member.summary: Selects if interest management should be used when running in mode. When enabled, clients will only receive updates for objects within their AOI range or which are set to .

member.name: F:Fusion.SimulationConfig.SimulationCulling
member.summary: Uses area of interest queries to cull execution of Fixed Update Network for objects outside of any players area of interest.

member.name: P:Fusion.SimulationConfig.DeltaTime
member.summary: Returns the inverse of TickRate. The time (in seconds) between simulation ticks.

member.name: P:Fusion.SimulationConfig.ServerDeltaTime
member.summary: Returns ( * ).

member.name: F:Fusion.SimulationConfig.ServerPacketInterval
member.summary: This value times TickRate determines the network send rate for the server. A value of 1 instructs the server to send state updates to clients every simulation tick. Values greater than 1 will send a input/state updates every N ticks. Higher values reduce data usage, in exchange for increased latency and reduced state sync accuracy.

member.name: F:Fusion.SimulationConfig.ClientPacketInterval
member.summary: This value times TickRate determines the network send rate for clients. A value of 1 instructs clients to send input/state updates to the server every simulation tick. Values greater than 1 will send an update every N ticks. Higher values reduce data usage, in exchange for increased latency and reduced state sync accuracy.

member.name: P:Fusion.SimulationConfig.ServerPacketDeltaTime
member.summary: Returns ( * ). This is the effective time interval (in seconds) between server tick updates to clients.

member.name: P:Fusion.SimulationConfig.ClientPacketDeltaTime
member.summary: Returns ( * ). This is the effective time interval (in seconds) between client input/state updates from the client.

member.name: F:Fusion.InterpolationConfiguration.DeltaAdjustment
member.summary:
How much the delta time is modulated up/down to adjust interpolation time when the client has ended up behind or ahead of the server. Common values are 1% to 3%, the lower the tick rate the higher this should be.
Default value is 1%.

member.name: F:Fusion.InterpolationConfiguration.AllowedJitter
member.summary:
How much the actual interpolation time is allowed to drift up/down from the calculated optimal time before adjustments to the interpolation time is made. Defined in % of optimal interpolation time. For example with a 25% value and an optimal interpolation time of 0.1 seconds, the actual interpolation time is allowed to very between 0.75-0.125 before adjustments are made to it.
Default value is 25%.

member.name: F:Fusion.InterpolationConfiguration.SnapLimit
member.summary:
How much actual interpolation time is allowed to drift up/down from calculated optimal time before the time calculations are reset and snapped to the optimal value. Defined in % of optimal time. Common values are 200% to 500%.
Default value is 200%.

member.name: F:Fusion.InterpolationConfiguration.MultiplierMin
member.summary: The minimum multiplier that is used to compensate for jitter and uncertainty when calculating optimal interpolation offset. This multiplier is used to give some extra interpolation offset from the absolutely optimal time.

member.name: F:Fusion.InterpolationConfiguration.MultiplierMax
member.summary: Same as the Multiplier Min, just the max value instead.

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkSimulationConfiguration.AdditionalJitter
member.summary: After the delay value from the Delay Shape oscillator is determined, this many additional seconds of jitter will be added to the packet latency.

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkSimulationConfiguration.LossChanceShape
member.summary: The noise pattern used to oscillate between Loss Chance Min and Loss Chance Max values.

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkSimulationConfiguration.LossChanceMin
member.summary: The lowest loss chance value the Loss Chance Shape oscillator will produce. 0 = 0% chance of being lost. 1 = 100% chance of being lost.

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkSimulationConfiguration.LossChanceMax
member.summary: The highest loss chance value the Loss Chance Shape oscillator will produce. 0 = 0% chance of being lost. 1 = 100% chance of being lost.

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkSimulationConfiguration.LossChanceThreshold
member.summary: The wave oscillates between 0 and 1. Values below this threshold are reduced to zero, resulting in a value equal to min.

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkSimulationConfiguration.LossChancePeriod
member.summary: The period of the Loss Chance Shape oscillator.

member.name: F:Fusion.NetworkSimulationConfiguration.AdditionalLoss
member.summary: After the Oscillation pattern between Min and Max is calculated, this additional loss chance is added.
